text: Dysprosium () is a chemical element with the symbol Dy and atomic number 66. It has a very high melting temperature of 1,407°C. It can also absorb neutrons. This makes it very suitable for use with nuclear reactors and lasers. Dysprosium is a rare earth element that has a metallic, bright silver luster. Dysprosium was first identified in Paris in 1886 by French chemist Paul Émile Lecoq de Boisbaudran. == Compounds == * Fluorides: DyF3 * Chlorides: DyCl2, DyCl3 * Bromides: DyBr2, DyBr3 * Iodides: DyI2, DyI3 * Oxides: Dy2O3 * Sulfides: Dy2S3 * Nitrides: DyN == Other websites == * WebElements.com – Dysprosium * Los Alamos National Laboratory – Dysprosium Category:Lanthanides
title: Dysprosium
